newsitem.title: CANADA: Alberta approves Dow ethylene expansion.
newsitem.headline: Alberta approves Dow ethylene expansion.

text.p: Alberta's regulator said on Tuesday it approved Dow Chemical Co unit Dow Chemical Canada Inc's plans to double the capacity of its ethylene plant at Fort Saskatchewan at a cost of C$183 million.
The Alberta Energy and Utilities Board had approved an application in 1990 to expand the plant, located outside of Edmonton, by 50 percent.
In its most recent application, Dow Chemical asked to add another 50 percent to capacity in a project that is slated to be completed by July 1998.

In its ruling, The AEUB said it noted Dow's commitment to maintain noise levels within provincial standards and was also satisfied that the company would make efforts to further reduce noise and flaring.
